title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) – In a stunning display of individual brilliance, Shaquille O’Neal authored one of the most dominant performances in NBA history, single-handedly dismantling the Minnesota Timberwolves in a 109-96 victory for the Los Angeles Lakers.

From the opening tip, this was the Shaq Show. The Lakers’ center was an unstoppable force, a wrecking ball in the painted area against which the Timberwolves had no answer. He powered his way to a colossal 44 points, a staggering total that dwarfed the contributions of all others on the floor. This wasn't merely a scoring outburst; it was a complete and utter physical conquest.

O’Neal’s dominance extended to the glass, where he corralled 18 rebounds, controlling the game’s tempo at both ends. While the Timberwolves scrambled for solutions, the Lakers’ supporting cast played their roles to perfection. Nick Van Exel orchestrated the offense with 15 assists, repeatedly feeding the beast in the middle, while Eddie Jones provided a secondary scoring punch with 21 points.

Minnesota, led by Kevin Garnett’s 22 points and 14 rebounds, fought valiantly but was simply overmatched by the historic force wearing purple and gold. The Lakers’ strategy was elegantly simple: give the ball to Shaq. The result was a masterpiece of power and precision, a signature night that reinforced O’Neal’s standing as the most formidable presence in the game and a performance for the ages.
